basics.name: Boris Ning
basics.label: Site Reliability Engineer
basics.summary: An engineer looking to solve real world problems with realistic solutions across various technology stacks

work.summary: Advisory role on cloud migration strategy and platform building for data modernization initiative
highlights: Promote DevSecOps through the practice of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) security

work.summary: Infrastructure engineering and Advisor for the redesign of ssa.gov
highlights: Supported the Office of the Chief Business Officer (OCBO) via beta.ssa.gov
Technical author for the assessment of ssa.gov authority to operate (ATO)
Implemented a technical solution to redesign the site from 60,000 pages to 40 pages.

work.summary: Site Reliability Engineering within the Office of the Chief Technology Officer
highlights: Built a monitoring system for a public Department of Defense (DoD) login system
Modernization and design of enterprise cloud environments for technology systems
Led Oncall for major incidents and handling of postmortems for a portfolio of IT systems
Design large scale hub-and-spoke network architecture for hundreds of engineering teams on AWS and Azure

work.summary: Maintained the reliability of the customer DDoS protection platform through deep observability of the network traffic.
Developed a high performance real time embedded application in signal processing.

publications.name: Office of Management and Budget (OMB) Zero Trust Technical Reference Architecture
publications.summary: Technical guidance for organizations to secure cloud migrations through considerations for shared services and cloud security posture management

publications.name: Trusted Internet Connections 3.0 Initiative
publications.summary: A continuous series of guidance for improving internet points of presence and external network connections within an organization
